snippet: Gov. Pete Wilson today denied clemency for Robert Alton Harris, a condemned killer who is scheduled on Tuesday to become the first person to be executed in California in 25 years.   Mr. Harris's only hope for a reprieve now rests with the possibil...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson today denied clemency for Robert Alton Harris, a condemned killer who is scheduled on Tuesday to become the first person to be executed in California in 25 years. Mr. Harris's only hope for a reprieve now rests with the possibility of court appeals, although he would appear to have exhausted them. Several weeks ago the Supreme Court declined to review his case. At a clemency hearing on Wednesday, the Governor, a Republican who supports the death penalty, heard tearful pleas alternately depicting the 39-year-old Mr. Harris as a tragic figure who should be spared and as a vicious killer who should die.

headline.main: Governor of California Denies Killer Clemency
